explanation:
OS_TimeAssembleFromNanoseconds — This function is the only direct callee of OS_FileStat_Impl. To prove absence of indirect recursion you must examine its body (and any functions it calls) to ensure it does not (directly or transitively) call back to OS_FileStat_Impl.

stat — The target function calls stat(local_path,&st). The actual symbol/resolution used at link time (libc::stat or a project wrapper) must be checked to ensure that the called 'stat' implementation does not call (directly or indirectly) OS_FileStat_Impl.

OS_stat — The provided static call graph shows an OS_stat symbol that lists OS_FileStat_Impl as a callee. That suggests 'stat' might be mapped/overridden by OS_stat in this build. Include OS_stat so the analyzer can confirm whether OS_FileStat_Impl actually calls OS_stat (i.e. whether 'stat' resolves to OS_stat) and whether OS_stat forms a cycle that would create indirect recursion.
